# PTD Today Forward Watchlist (Rest of Year • Headline Signals Last 30 Days)

## 1) Themes to Watch
- US regulatory and policy actions impacting offshore wind project progress
- Scaling solar deployment in key growth markets including US, UK, India, Bangladesh, Nepal
- Rising competition and pricing pressures in solar wafer and module manufacturing, especially China
- Emerging AI applications and economics influencing energy digitalization and data centers
- Semiconductor industry developments amid fabrication facility expansions and technology bets
- Security and physical risks to critical subsea data infrastructure (e.g., cable sabotage)

## 2) What to Monitor Next

### Grid / Renewables
- US government and market actions affecting offshore wind (notably Orsted’s $5B US project challenge)
- UK and US solar CfD tenders and capacity targets for record deployment in 2026
- India’s battery storage policy requiring minimum local content and utility grid connection reforms
- Emerging floating PV innovations leveraging AI digital twins for optimization

### Oil & Gas
- No direct signals in provided feed items

### Data Centers & AI
- Security incidents affecting subsea cables relevant to data center connectivity and resilience
- AI “inference economics” as a factor shaping energy and compute cost structures
- Industry interest in AI applications for energy asset monitoring and digital twin technology

### Semiconductors
- Intel’s Arizona fab and broader chip making capacity under strategic scrutiny
- China wafer manufacturers adjusting quotes impacting module pricing dynamics

### Critical Minerals / Rare Earths
- No direct signals in provided feed items

## 3) Regions / Companies Appearing Repeatedly
- US: Offshore wind policy, solar market, utility regulation, Intel chip fab
- UK: Solar CfD market
- China: Solar manufacturing and offshore wind turbine capacity leadership
- India: Large-scale solar project completions and battery storage content mandates
- Companies: Orsted (offshore wind), Vestas (turbines), Intel (semiconductors), Waaree Energies (solar manufacturing), Apollo (wind farm co-owner)

## 4) Constraints / Risks Implied by Headlines
- Regulatory delays and government halts, exemplified by US stopping an offshore wind project
- Supply chain uncertainties including potential manufacturing exit from flagship solar projects
- Security risks to critical subsea cable infrastructure affecting data flow and connectivity
- Pricing volatility in solar wafers/modules may affect project economics
- Infrastructure project execution risks coupled with workforce and skills shortages in engineering sectors

---

This watchlist highlights strategic policy shifts, industrial activity, and emergent risk areas specifically relevant to energy transition technologies and critical connected infrastructure.
